channel.title: TravelCommons
channel.description: The Frequent Traveler's Podcast. The voice of the frequent traveler -- it's more about the journey than the destination
channel.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
channel.itunes:summary: The Frequent Traveler's Podcast. The voice of the frequent traveler -- it's more about the journey than the destination
channel.itunes:keywords: travel, travel podcast, business travel, travel stories, travel industry, travel tips, road warrior

item.title: High-Tech Airport Lines; Business Travel Still Missing
item.description:
Not much travel, but a lot of travel planning for our first post-lockdown international trip to Italy. Trying to thread our way through changing COVID rules and Alitalia’s bankruptcy throes. I’m getting inundated with discount offers for Clear’s fast-pass service. I’ve resisted them so far, because I remember back to when the first incarnation of Clear wanted to sell its members’ biometric data. We then talk to Xovis Technology‘s Cody Shulman about how airports are better managing all sorts of lines in airports. Finally, air passenger traffic is dropping again because business travelers are still MIA.

Check out this episode's show notes here
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)
item.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
item.itunes:subtitle: Planning our Italy trip around new COVID rules and Alitalia bankruptcy; airports managing lines with AI and high-tech sensors; business travelers still missing
item.itunes:summary: Planning our Italy trip around new COVID rules and Alitalia bankruptcy; airports managing lines with AI and high-tech sensors; business travelers still missing
item.itunes:keywords: Alitalia, business travel, CLEAR registered traveler, Global Entry, Italy, security lines, Southwest Airlines, travel planning, travel stories, travel tips, TSA, frequent traveler

item.title: What Remains from Pandemic Times; Best Restaurant and Bars
item.description:
Last month's travel got me wondering what travel changes are going to stick after the COVID pandemic begins to recede. With all the restaurant and bar closures caused by COVID lockdowns, I'm updating my recommendations list based on recent travels. And, I'm way overthinking our first post-lockdown international trip.

Check out this episode's show notes here and the blog post with my 2021 restaurant and bar recommendations here
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)
item.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
item.itunes:subtitle: Hotel changes and cashless restaurants likely to stick after pandemic fades; updating recommendations after restaurant and bar closures from COVID lockdowns
item.itunes:summary: Hotel changes and cashless restaurants likely to stick after pandemic fades; updating recommendations after restaurant and bar closures from COVID lockdowns
item.itunes:keywords: AirDrop, bars, Cash, Cashless, COVID travel rules, Hilton, Maine, Masks, Pandemic, restaurants, Southwest Airlines, travel podcast, travel stories, travel tips, TSA, Waze, frequent traveler

item.title: B-Sides and Rarities
item.description:
After a 2-week, 2,500-mile driving expedition through the Northeast, there wasn't much time to write a new episode. So, I mined recent interviews for stories that got left on the cutting room floor. Also talk about COVID planning for a fall trip to Italy and mourn the demise of American Airlines’ in-flight magazine.

Check out this episode's show notes here
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)
item.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
item.itunes:subtitle: Driving thru the Northeast; tracking COVID requirements for a fall Italy trip; updates to traveler gift guide; death of in-flight magazines; interview outtakes
item.itunes:summary: Driving thru the Northeast; tracking COVID requirements for a fall Italy trip; updates to traveler gift guide; death of in-flight magazines; interview outtakes
item.itunes:keywords: COVID test, COVID travel rules, dining, Driving, Gift Guide, In-Flight Entertainment, Italy, Maine, travel stories, TSA, travel tips, travel podcast, frequent traveler

item.title: Why Business Travel Is Coming Back; Learning Airport History
item.description:
Business travelers are getting itchy. They know Zoom calls can't replace a face-to-face meeting, but they can't meet with people who aren't in their offices yet. We also talk about how surprisingly great the LaGuardia Terminal B renovation is, and then talk about airport history with Professor Janet Bednarek, professor of history at University of Dayton.
Check out this episode's show notes here
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)
item.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
item.itunes:subtitle: Business travelers know Zoom calls do not replace face-to-face meetings and want to travel again; fantastic LaGuardia renovation; the early history of airports
item.itunes:summary: Business travelers know Zoom calls do not replace face-to-face meetings and want to travel again; fantastic LaGuardia renovation; the early history of airports
item.itunes:keywords: Airports, business travel, Dayton, Frequent Traveler, History, LaGuardia, Miami, PreCheck, Ride Sharing, travel stories, travel tips, TSA, Uber

item.title: How to Find Local Tour Guides; Rebuild Travel Muscles
item.description:
I can feel travel beginning to come back. TSA checkpoint volumes are hitting post-pandemic highs, business travelers are starting to come out from behind their Zoom sessions, and vaccination rates are prompting more people to make travel plans. So on this episode, we first talk to Paul Melhus, CEO of ToursByLocals about the state of the local tour market and then about how frequent travelers are starting to stretch their atrophied travel muscles.
Check out this episode's show notes here
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)
item.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
item.itunes:subtitle: Feeling travel coming back, we talk to CEO of ToursByLocals about the local tour market and then how frequent travelers are working on atrophied travel muscles.
item.itunes:summary: Feeling travel coming back, we talk to CEO of ToursByLocals about the local tour market and then how frequent travelers are working on atrophied travel muscles.
item.itunes:keywords: business travel, Chase Sapphire Visa, COVID, Frequent Traveler, Guided Tours, Hertz, PreCheck, Real ID, Ride Sharing, Travel Insurance, travel podcast, travel stories, travel tips, Uber

item.title: How the Pros Plan Their Taproom Tourism
item.description:
Looking at the Beer section of this new website design, I saw I needed more content. So I got hold of Rob Cheshire of the This Week in Craft Beer podcast to talk about our approaches to taproom tourism and to trade taproom travel stories. I also talk about mask hassles on a couple of recent flights, Hertz's continuing downward service spiral, and Uber and Lyft driver shortages.
Check out this episode's show notes here and the uncut video of Rob's and my beer chat here
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)
item.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
item.itunes:subtitle: Why and how we search out craft beer taprooms, and telling some taproom travel stories; Also mask hassles on my last couple of flights, Hertz continues to circle the drain; Uber and Lyft splashing cash to bring back drivers
item.itunes:summary: Why and how we search out craft beer taprooms, and telling some taproom travel stories; Also mask hassles on my last couple of flights, Hertz continues to circle the drain; Uber and Lyft splashing cash to bring back drivers

item.title: What's New in Travel Insurance; Keeping Ahead of Expiring Miles
item.description:
As travel bookings beginning to rise with vaccination rates, we talk with Michael Giusti of InsuranceQuotes.com to find out what's changed over the last year. I make the rounds through all my frequent traveler programs to reset impending expiration dates. We also talk about yet another travel data breach, a favorite beer bar is a COVID casualty, and bankrupt Hertz is starting to let its cars get old.
Check out this episode's show notes here
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)
item.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
item.itunes:subtitle: What's new in travel insurance; resetting expiration dates on all my frequent traveler programs; another travel data breach; bankrupt Hertz letting cars get old

item.title: Timeshares Without the Pitch; Notes on Tucson
item.description:
Escaped the Chicago winter for a week of hiking in the mountains around Tucson and searching for good Sonoran food. We also talk with Mike Kennedy, CEO and Co-Founder of Koala about how he’s making it easy to rent timeshares without buying into them. Also, how travel planning got hot but then cooled back down, and trying to extend the life of my Avios points
Check out this episode's show notes here and my Tucson trip blog post here
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)

item.title: Data Privacy and Rental Cars; 2021 Travel Planning Tips
item.description:
Was all set to head to San Diego for a week’s break from Chicago’s grey January and then looked at the COVID restrictions… and then pivoted to Arizona. With people starting to think about 2021 travel, I pulled together my top 5 travel planning tips. Slow vaccine roll-out will probably keep us restricted for longer than we thought. Andrea Amico of Privacy4Cars joins us to talk about the dangers of leaving our data behind in rental cars.
Check out this episode's show notes here
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)
item.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
item.itunes:subtitle: Pivot from San Diego to Tucson for COVID restrictions; planning tips for travel during COVID; CEO of Privacy4Cars talks about leaving data behind in rental cars
item.itunes:summary: Pivot from San Diego to Tucson for COVID restrictions; planning tips for travel during COVID; CEO of Privacy4Cars talks about leaving data behind in rental cars
item.itunes:keywords: Arizona, Bluetooth, California, car rental, Covid, Data Privacy, Digital Vaccine Passports, Fake Vaccination, Hertz, Python, travel planning, travel tips, travel stories, Untappd, Vaccination

item.title: Show Me the Proof; Hereditary Road Warriors
item.description:
No Thanksgiving travel, but looking at the travel volume for this, the busiest travel week of the year, shows just how far things have fallen. The Qantas CEO said “No vax, no fly”, so we dig into the emerging world of digital vaccine passports. And then I trace my travel genealogy, wondering if road warrior-ism is hereditary.
Check out this episode's show notes here
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)
item.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
item.itunes:subtitle: Thanksgiving travel volume shows how far things have fallen; we dig into digital vaccine passports; tracing my travel genealogy, is road warrior-ism hereditary?
item.itunes:summary: Thanksgiving travel volume shows how far things have fallen; we dig into digital vaccine passports; tracing my travel genealogy, is road warrior-ism hereditary?
item.itunes:keywords: Coronavirus, Covid-19, Digital Vaccine Passports, Holiday Travel, Hotel Room Cooking, Hyatt, O’Hare International Airport, Road Warriors, Siri, Thanksgiving, Vaccination, travel stories, travel tips, travel podcast

item.title: Pandemic Holiday Gift Guide; Year-End Status Offers
item.description:
No travel since the last episode, so I had some time to think back through my post-lockdown travel and come up with my top 10 gift ideas for your pandemic travelers. We look at the start of the year-end efforts by airlines, hotels, and credit card companies to keep their grounded travelers, unpack the work-from-hotel offerings from Marriott, Hilton, and Hyatt, and dissect the latest hotel reservation system data breach.
Check out this episode's show notes here
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)
item.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
item.itunes:subtitle: Top 10 gift ideas for pandemic travelers; year-end status offers from airlines, hotels, and travel credit cards; work-from-hotel offerings; latest hotel reservation system data breach.

item.title: Surviving Quarantine Theater; Traveling for Food
item.description: Trying to recover from a long weekend of eating and drinking through the neighborhoods of South Philly. Our movable feast reminded me that food may be the one experience of a place left that can’t be easily exported and bought on-line. We talk about the FBI’s cybersecurity warning to work-from-home types using hotels for getaway offices, and are a bit amazed at how fast last year’s 'flight shaming' gave way to 'flights to nowhere.' And we think about 'quarantine theater' — how cities and states are focusing on activities to signal they are serious about COVID, but that most folks know aren’t really effective.
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)
item.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
item.itunes:subtitle: Eating local in South Philly and the UP; FBI cybersecurity warning on working from hotels; ‘flight shaming’ gives way to ‘flights to nowhere’; signaling concern about COVID does nothing but hassles travelers
item.itunes:summary: Eating local in South Philly and the UP; FBI cybersecurity warning on working from hotels; ‘flight shaming’ gives way to ‘flights to nowhere’; signaling concern about COVID does nothing but hassles travelers
item.itunes:keywords: Chicago, Coronavirus, Covid-19, Cyber Security, FBI, Flight Shaming, food, Hygiene Theater, Maine, Michigan, Pasties, Philadelphia, Quarantine, Quarantine Theater, Upper Peninsula, VPN, Travel Stories, Travel Tips, Travel Podcast

item.title: Looking Back Over Four Years of TravelCommons
item.description: The fourth year anniversary episode of TravelCommons
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)
item.itunes:subtitle: The fourth year anniversary episode of TravelCommons
item.itunes:summary: Recorded in the Seattle Marriott Waterfront, this special 4th-year anniversary edition collates the best bits from four years of TravelCommons podcasts. Starting with the "hotel medley" -- the roll call of all the hotels that have served as TravelCommons recording studios, we move on to excerpts from stories about the TSA, Bose headphones, memories of better airplane food, the hassles of travel, and some of the most entertaining sights I've seen in the last four years.
item.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
item.itunes:keywords: travel, business travel, travel stories, anniversary show
